name: The National Hotel and Suites Ottawa

reviews.text: Overall the facility was in good reapir and good condition. The rooms were clean, no issues to due to cleanliness or the accomidations in the facility. Other reviews with regards to the "need for updating" are purly false. The staff are generally helpful, however; are not professional (in terms of behaviour and are disruptive to the lobby.)
reviews.title: Sub-Average Stay (Staff Not Very Knowldgeable, Accomidations Good)

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Needs some updating.

reviews.text: -> Comfortable bedding and room was clean.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel, Perfect Stay

reviews.text: -> Pricing is reasonable.
reviews.title: It's not the Delta

reviews.text: -> Selection of in-room dining and facility dining services are ample.
reviews.title: Not a good experience
Name change effective Feb. 1
reviews.text: The Delta Ottawa Hotel and Suites will be re-branded "The National" effective February 1, 2012. The former Crowne Plaza kitty-corner across the street is under renovation as the Delta Ottawa Centre.

Let me be upfront - this is not a hotel where women travellers would feel comfortable. Access to rooms unsecure – every morning woke up to advertisements for “massages” and pizza under door. Banging on the doors in the early morning hours by unruly guests. Used condom in the corner of the guest room elevator at 8 am. Did not feel safe walking to from hotel in evening – it is 20 minutes away from restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Stayed two nights for business, moved as soon as I could get room elsewhere

reviews.text: I took the time to write and express my concerns to the manager, and received a generic email three weeks later that did not address any issues.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s hit or miss as to whether you can park at the hotel – there is no valet parking available – I was told by hotel staff they lost their license to park due to some “incidents”. It is a privately owned parkade and there are no specific spots reserved for hotel guests that I could find.
reviews.title: The worst place to spend New Years Eve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no formal valet or luggage assistance available.
reviews.title: Always an excellent stay

reviews.text: Been to this hotel a few times, although not recently. Had a short stay here last week, and now it's called The National. Location is good, a short walk to the parliament.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.text: Beware that this hotel is crowded with families with kids because of their pool and water slides facility. Their gym is right next to it, so you get to smell all the chlorine. And it's very low ceiling so you cannot raise the dumbell without hitting the ceiling.
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel

reviews.text: The room is clean, but definitely in need of a renovation to get rid of the 80's deco in the bathroom. A flat-screen TV would be nice too.
reviews.title: Building is older but well kept

reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel to accomodate a family of four. This hotel is not too expensive or fancy but the pool is great, the rooms are large and it is within walking distance to all major attractions in Ottawa.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed here in Ottawa for a Winterlude vacation. We had a suite with a king bed (in a separate room), pull out couch and kitchenette. It was quite nice. Our friends rented the same type of room and theirs also had a table, but not as good of a view. The building is starting to show its age in some areas but is kept very clean. It is a simple, but nice hotel. The staff were very friendly. The brunch at the resaurant was good and a reasonable price because kids under 6 ate free. The salt water pool is not as large as it seems in the pictures, but is sufficient and it is nice that it is salt water. It also has a hot tub. The waterslide was a hit with my 5 year old (there is a height restriction so smaller kids cannot go on it). Unfortunately it is in a separate room beside the pool, and so it was not as accessible as I would have liked, plus it was very cold where the slide was. The kids game and play room was a hit with my little ones. The hotel is centrally located for the downtown business core of Ottawa (it is about a 5 minute walk to Parliament Buildings and a 15 minute walk to the Byward market). I found the parking a bit pricey for the weekend. Overall a great hotel, especially for a family.
reviews.title: In drastic need of renovation

reviews.text: one night stay, but overall a nice place.
reviews.title: Clean and well located
